text: Ralph Henry Baer (March 8, 1922 - December 6, 2014) was a German-American inventor and engineer, known for his contributions to the video game industry. Because he was of Jewish descent,www.legacy.com Baer moved to New York City in 1938. He later became a U.S. citizen. He died at his home in Manchester, New Hampshire on December 6, 2014, according to family and friends close to him.
